description: The integration of phase change materials (PCMs) in lithium-ion battery packs has been studied, and the use of anisotropic representation in phase-field simulations of electrodeposition has been explored, but no study combines these concepts to analyze thermal performance of lithium-ion battery packs with anisotropic electrodeposition
value: Could lead to improved thermal management and stability in lithium-ion battery packs

description: Paper 2208.12902v1 shows that the proposed formulation exhibits low sensitivity to numerical parameters, but Paper 2201.02891v1 mentions that some knee pathways have internal state trajectories with signals that are electrochemically undetectable, which may indicate a contradiction in the sensitivity of numerical parameters to detect knee pathways
value: Resolving this contradiction could improve the accuracy of lithium-ion battery aging models

description: The airflow speed in lithium-ion battery packs has only been tested in the range of 0.0-15.0 m/s, but the performance of the battery pack at higher or lower airflow speeds is unknown
value: Exploring a wider range of airflow speeds could lead to optimized thermal management strategies for lithium-ion battery packs

description: The use of hetero-epitaxial residual stresses to suppress dendrite formation has been explored in aqueous zinc-ion batteries, but this concept could be applied to lithium-ion batteries to improve their stability and safety
value: Could lead to improved stability and safety in lithium-ion batteries

description: The exact mechanism by which phase change materials (PCMs) stabilize thermal behavior in lithium-ion battery packs is unclear, and further research is needed to understand the underlying processes
value: Understanding the mechanism could lead to optimized PCM design and improved thermal management in lithium-ion battery packs

description: The concept of knee modeling in lithium-ion battery aging trajectories has been explored, and the use of solid-ion conductors (SICs) to suppress dendrite formation has been studied, but no study combines these concepts to analyze the effect of SICs on knee formation in lithium-ion batteries
value: Could lead to improved understanding of lithium-ion battery aging mechanisms and strategies to mitigate knee formation
